Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the defacement of the 9/11 Memorial in NYC with graffiti, which the expert's verdict confirms did not happen.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or news coverage to support the assertion that the 9/11 Memorial was defaced with graffiti.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the 9/11 Memorial in NYC was not defaced with graffiti, as confirmed by the spokesperson for the 9/11 Memorial & Museum.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the defacement of a different 9/11 memorial in Plymouth, Massachusetts, is related to the one in NYC, which is not supported by evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim presents an alternative explanation for the continued support for demonstrations over the death of George Floyd by falsely linking it to the defacement of the 9/11 Memorial.
